008 *******************************************************************************/
009
010package imagingbook.common.image.access;
011
012import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.image.GridIndexer2D;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
017import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * An 'image accessor' is a wrapper around some {@link ImageProcessor} object to
022 * allow unified (read and write) access to its pixels values. This abstract
023 * class defines unified access functionality to all 4 types of images available
024 * in ImageJ: 8-bit, 16-bit, float, and color images. All pixel values are of
025 * type {@code float[]}, either containing a single element (for scalar-valued
026 * images) or three elements (for color images).
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * A generic {@link ImageAccessor} is created, e.g., by
030 * {@link #create(ImageProcessor)}, which returns an instance of
031 * {@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor}, {@link FloatAccessor} or
032 * {@link RgbAccessor}. {@link ImageAccessor} itself can access any ImageJ image
033 * using the methods {@link #getPix(int, int)}, {@link #getPix(double, double)}
034 * for retrieving pixel values and {@link #setPix(int, int, float[])} to modify
035 * pixel values.
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 * In addition, the accessors for scalar-valued images ({@link ByteAccessor},
039 * {@link ShortAccessor}, {@link FloatAccessor}) provide the methods
040 * {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(int, int)},
041 * {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} and
042 * {@link ScalarAccessor#setVal(int, int, float)} to read and write
043 * scalar-valued pixels passed as single {@code float} values. <br>
044 * The methods {@link #getPix(double, double)} and
045 * {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} perform interpolation at
046 * non-integer coordinates using the specified {@link InterpolationMethod}.
047 * </p>
048 * <p>
049 * A related concept for providing unified access to images is
050 * {@link PixelPack}, which copies all pixel data to internal {@code float}
051 * arrays. In contrast to {@link PixelPack}, {@link ImageAccessor} does not
052 * duplicate any data but reads and writes the original {@link ImageProcessor}
053 * pixel data directly.
054 * </p>
055 * 
056 * @author WB
057 * @version 2020/12/27
058 * @see PixelPack
059 */
060public abstract class ImageAccessor {
061        
062        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
063        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues;
064        /** The default pixel interpolation method (see {@link InterpolationMethod}). */
065        public static final InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
066        
067        protected final float defaultValue = 0.0f;
068        
069        protected final ImageProcessor ip;
070        protected final int width;
071        protected final int height;
072        protected final GridIndexer2D indexer;          // implements the specified OutOfBoundsStrategy
073        protected final OutOfBoundsStrategy outOfBoundsStrategy;
074        protected final InterpolationMethod interpolationMethod;
075        
076        /**
077         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
078         * using the default out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation method.
079         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image.
080         * 
081         * @param ip the source image
082         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
083         */
084        public static final ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip) {
085                return create(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
090         * using the specified out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation method.
091         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image.
092         * 
093         * @param ip the source image
094         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy (use {@code null} for default settings)
095         * @param ipm the interpolation method (use {@code null} for default settings)
096         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
097         */
098        public static ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip,  OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
099                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
100                        return new RgbAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, obs, ipm);
101                }
102                else {
103                        return ScalarAccessor.create(ip, obs, ipm);
104                }
105        }
106        
107        // constructor (used by all subtypes)
108        ImageAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
109                this.ip = ip;
110                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
111                this.height = ip.getHeight();
112                this.outOfBoundsStrategy = (obs != null) ? obs : DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy;
113                this.interpolationMethod = (ipm != null) ? ipm : DefaultInterpolationMethod;
114                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, this.outOfBoundsStrategy);
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Returns the width of the associated image.
119         * @return the image width.
120         */
121        public int getWidth() {
122                return this.width;
123        }
124        
125        /**
126         * Returns the height of the associated image.
127         * @return the image height.
128         */
129        public int getHeight() {
130                return this.height;
131        }
132        
133        /**
134         * Returns the source {@link ImageProcessor} associated with this
135         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
136         * 
137         * @return the image processor
138         */
139        public ImageProcessor getProcessor() {
140                return this.ip;
141        }
142        
143        /**
144         * Returns the depth (number of components) of this image
145         * accessor. 1 is returned if the image is scalar-valued.
146         * 
147         * @return the image depth.
148         */
149        public abstract int getDepth();
150        
151        /**
152         * Returns the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified for this
153         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
154         * 
155         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
156         */
157        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
158                return outOfBoundsStrategy;
159        }
160
161        /**
162         * Returns the {@link InterpolationMethod} specified for this
163         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
164         * 
165         * @return the interpolation method
166         */
167        public InterpolationMethod getInterpolationMethod() {
168                return interpolationMethod;
169        }
170        
171        /**
172         * Returns the pixel value for the specified floating-point 
173         * position as a {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
174         * and or more elements (e.g., 3 for for RGB images).
175         * 
176         * @param u the x-coordinate
177         * @param v the y-coordinate
178         * @return the pixel value ({@code float[]})
179         */
180        public abstract float[] getPix(int u, int v);
181        
182        /**
183         * Returns the interpolated pixel value for the specified floating-point 
184         * position as a {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
185         * and or more elements (e.g., 3 for for RGB images).
186         * Interpolation is used non-integer coordinates.
187         * 
188         * @param x the x-coordinate
189         * @param y the y-coordinate
190         * @return the interpolated pixel value ({@code float[]})
191         */
192        public abstract float[] getPix(double x, double y);             // returns interpolated pixel value at real position (x, y)
193        
194        /**
195         * Sets the pixel value at the specified integer position.
196         * The new value must be provided as {@code float[]} with 
197         * 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
198         * @param u the x-coordinate
199         * @param v the y-coordinate
200         * @param val the new pixel value ({@code float[]})
201         */
202        public abstract void setPix(int u, int v, float[] val);
203        
204        /**
205         * Returns the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
206         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
207         * this is equivalent to component 0.
208         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
209         * 
210         * @param u the x-coordinate
211         * @param v the y-coordinate
212         * @param k the component index
213         * @return the component value ({@code float})
214         */
215        public abstract float getVal(int u, int v, int k);
216        
217        
218        /**
219         * Returns the interpolated value of the pixel's k-th component at the
220         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
221         * this is equivalent to component 0.
222         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
223         * 
224         * @param x the x-coordinate
225         * @param y the y-coordinate
226         * @param k the component index
227         * @return the interpolated component value ({@code float[]})
228         */
229        public abstract float getVal(double x, double y, int k);
230        
231        /**
232         * Sets the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
233         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
234         * this is equivalent to component 0.
235         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
236         * 
237         * @param u the x-coordinate
238         * @param v the y-coordinate
239         * @param k the component index
240         * @param val the new component value
241         */
242        public abstract void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val);
243        
244        /**
245         * Returns the {@link ImageAccessor} for the k-th component;
246         * the result is a sub-type of {@link ScalarAccessor}.
247         * In the case of a scalar-valued image, THIS object is returned.
248         * 
249         * @param k the component index
250         * @return the component accessor.
251         */
252        public abstract ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k);
253        
254        abstract void checkComponentIndex(int k);
255                
256}
